description: Borrowed from Latin acroamaticus, acroaticus (“esoteric”), at first chiefly in reference to the “esoteric” and originally oral teachings of Aristotle, from Ancient Greek ἀκροαματικός (akroamatikós, “for hearing only; esoteric”), from ἀκροάομαι (akroáomai, “to listen”).

adjectives.description: acroamatic (comparative more acroamatic, superlative most acroamatic)

entries.meaning: Esoteric, abstruse; (in particular) taught orally to select students and not disseminated.
(education) Based on lectures or exposition by monologue.
